title: Jaylen Brown reveals Kevin Garnett as his favorite Celtic of all time
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Boston Celtics "I love the intensity that KG has always brought to the game.
He just plays the game with a fire and a rage that I resonate with.
" Kevin Garnett before game 1 against the Cavaliers in the 2008 playoffs (Winslow Townson/AP).

title: NH mother charged after her 6-year-old daughter tests positive for cannabinoids and cocaine
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime Paige Goulet was also charged for tampering with witnesses.
A New Hampshire mother was charged on Monday after her 6-year-old ingested a THC gummy and tested positive for cannabinoids and cocaine.

title: 19-year-old seriously injured, allegedly jumped on vehicle in Duxbury
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News The Pembroke man had reportedly gone to his ex-girlfriend's residence to confront her current boyfriend.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A 19-year-old Pembroke man jumped onto the hood of a car in Duxbury on Wednesday and then was thrown from the moving vehicle, witnesses told police.

title: Boston Legacy FC announce signing of goalkeeper Hannah Stambaugh
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Sports "I’m excited, being a part of a brand new team with endless potential and the ability to make a new future.
" Goalkeeper Hannah Stambaugh and Boston Legacy FC general manager Domènec Guasch after Stambaugh signed with the club as its first ever goalkeeper.

Via Boston Legacy FC By Hayden Bird December 11, 2025 | 11:41 AM 1 minute to read Boston Legacy FC continue to build an expansion roster ahead of the team’s NWSL debut in March, announcing the signing of the club’s first goalkeeper on Thursday morning.

title: Corvette removed from T tracks in Brookline
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News The driver was unlicensed, and the vehicle was unregistered and uninsured, police said.
MBTA Transit Police ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A Corvette Stingray was removed from T tracks in Brookline late Wednesday afternoon.

title: Gender wage gap decreases by 43% in Greater Boston, but it’s complicated
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Business Meanwhile, the racial wage gap widened for the second consecutive cycle.
The gender wage gap in Greater Boston decreased by 43% this year, while the racial wage gap widened.

title: 60 birds confiscated from suspected Mass. cockfighting operation
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime The birds are being held at an undisclosed location as court proceedings play out.
Photos via MSPCA-Angell MSPCA-Angell has seized more than 60 birds from an alleged cockfighting operation in Springfield.
After starting an investigation a few months ago, the MSPCA-Angell investigative team, alongside Massachusetts State Police, executed a warrant at a property on Wednesday, according to a release.

title: ‘Every single guy has something to prove’: Bill Simmons tried to explain Celtics’ positive start to the season
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update "There isn't a single guy on this team who's not like, 'I'm so happy to be a part of this.
'" Jaylen Brown is introduced prior to a Celtics-Knicks game earlier in December.

title: Skiers and riders, do you use the safety bar on the chairlift?
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Skiing Some skiers and riders are "weird" about it, says Ski magazine.
Skiers on the chairlift at Killington in Vermont earlier this year.
Jessica Rinaldi/Globe Staff By Kristi Palma December 11, 2025 | 10:18 AM 1 minute to read Ski magazine says skiers and riders can be “weird” about chairlift safety bars.

title: Man pleads guilty to Mass. kidnapping, Vermont murder from the 1980s
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime David Morrison, 65, of Vacaville, California, is currently serving a life sentence with the possibility of parole after 25 years in California for other charges.
David Morrison Handout ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A California man pleaded guilty to a 1981 Massachusetts kidnapping and a a 1986 Vermont murder on Tuesday.
